reviewText: For dance is evident..The narrated conversation with the soul that Jean Erdman presents to us here is well recieved by me.'Ophelia'--The journey of a tortured soul resonates clearly with my former troubled self--The overcoming of this in 'Passage'--Rocks! ABout "finally making the leap into spiritual space--Forever suspended in air"--Drama babes! The narration accompanying those two dances brought them to LIFE..Worth the money!'Medusa's about a very "dangerous woman" (to quote a de Beavoir book title)who "rages across the universe forever" because "the positive life energy was never fulfilled"--snap girlfriend--oh no you di-dint! She freaks out..SOO possible! Life is FRAGILE mon--Gots to get in touch with that INNER CORE ya'll..Allison (Nancy Allison..)--A Hebrew goddess if I'm correct--brings out the altruist in us--Just watching her joyously--"sheer joy of movement"--quoting Erdman--dance in her dances is wonderful--Carrying on the legacy of Erdman with a sensitivity that'll make you fall in love. Crap I live way out here. Muna Tseng dances bad a** 'Medusa' and Leslie Dillingham SCORES with "Ophelia."--Dancing them hard moves to amaze a crowd of anyone--Even them puffs eatin football fans won't fail to be impressed with those moves! Jean Erdman's narration is awesome also. Think I'm in love..Nancy Allisons not an ugly woman. Love ya'll..P.S.,P.S,(SNNAAAP!: Ya'll I almost forgot..)The followups to these lovely programs are..(Drum roll please..:)1.Dance & Myth 2: Group Dances [VHS and..2:Dance & Myth 3: Later Solos [VHS]..Nancy..HEELLLooo...I'm super fan..
